## Introduction
Queen Elizabeth II is the current reigning monarch of the United Kingdom and other Commonwealth realms. She ascended to the throne on February 6, 1952, following the death of her father, King George VI. Queen Elizabeth II is the longest-reigning current monarch, having surpassed the previous record held by her great-great-grandmother, Queen Victoria, on September 9, 2015.

## Key Terms
- Monarch: A sovereign head of state, typically a king or queen, who holds supreme authority and power.
- Commonwealth realms: Countries that recognize Queen Elizabeth II as their monarch, including the United Kingdom, Canada, Australia, and others.
- Reign: The period of time during which a monarch rules.

## Detailed Life
Queen Elizabeth II was born on April 21, 1926, in London, England. She was the first child of the Duke and Duchess of York, who later became King George VI and Queen Elizabeth (the Queen Mother). Elizabeth had a younger sister, Princess Margaret.

During World War II, Elizabeth served in the Auxiliary Territorial Service as a mechanic and driver. She married Philip Mountbatten, Duke of Edinburgh, in 1947, and they have four children: Charles, Anne, Andrew, and Edward.

Queen Elizabeth II has played a significant role in modernizing the British monarchy and adapting it to the changing times. She has witnessed numerous historical events, including the end of the British Empire, the Cold War, and the rise of the digital age.

Throughout her reign, Queen Elizabeth II has been known for her dedication to public service and her commitment to the Commonwealth. She has undertaken numerous state visits, met with world leaders, and represented the United Kingdom on the global stage.

## Little Known Facts
- Queen Elizabeth II is the first British monarch to have celebrated a Sapphire Jubilee, marking 65 years on the throne.
- She has owned more than 30 corgis during her reign, a breed of dog that has become synonymous with the Queen.

## Examples
- Queen Elizabeth II played a significant role in the Diamond Jubilee celebrations in 2012, marking her 60 years on the throne.
- She delivered a historic speech on the occasion of her Golden Jubilee in 2002, reflecting on her reign and the changes she has witnessed.

## Historical Context
Queen Elizabeth II's reign has spanned a period of significant historical events and societal changes. She ascended to the throne in the aftermath of World War II, a time when the British Empire was undergoing decolonization. The Queen has witnessed the transformation of the United Kingdom into a modern constitutional monarchy and the changing dynamics of the Commonwealth.

## Questions and Answers
1. Q: How old was Queen Elizabeth II when she became queen?
   A: Queen Elizabeth II was 25 years old when she became queen.

2. Q: How many countries recognize Queen Elizabeth II as their monarch?
   A: Queen Elizabeth II is recognized as the monarch of 16 Commonwealth realms.

## Family-Friends
Queen Elizabeth II has a close-knit family. Her husband, Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, was her steadfast companion until his death in 2021. Her eldest son, Prince Charles, is the heir apparent to the throne. She also has three other children: Princess Anne, Prince Andrew, and Prince Edward. Queen Elizabeth II has numerous grandchildren and great-grandchildren.

## Quotes
- "I declare before you all that my whole life, whether it be long or short, shall be devoted to your service and the service of our great imperial family to which we all belong." - Queen Elizabeth II, 21st birthday speech in 1947.
- "Grief is the price we pay for love." - Queen Elizabeth II, in a speech following the death of Princess Diana.
